text: "You're Gonna Miss Me When I'm Gone" is a song co-written and recorded by American country music duo Brooks & Dunn. It was released in June 1995 as the fourth single from their third album Waitin' on Sundown. The song reached the top of the Billboard Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart. This is the third single to feature Kix Brooks on lead vocals instead of Ronnie Dunn, and the only single of such that was one of Brooks & Dunn's 20 Billboard No. 1 hits. The song was written by the duo along with Don Cook. ==Content== The male narrator explains to his significant other that she has constantly been mistreating him, and although he still shows great affection for her, he ultimately comes to the realization that their relationship is in serious jeopardy because of her actions and therefore contemplates ending the relationship for good. Beforehand, the narrator presents his soon-to-be former lover an opportunity to give him a farewell kiss, informing her that she will regret the mistakes that she had made and will miss him after he leaves her. ==Critical reception== Billboard's Eric Boehler praised the craftsmanship and production of the song, simply calling it "another welcome Brooks & Dunn outing."Boehlert, Eric. "The modern age." Billboard 13 May 1995: JuniorQuest Magazines, ProQuest. Web. Retrieved 28 Sep. 2010. Deborah Evans Price, also of Billboard, reviewed the song favorably, calling it a welcome change of pace from their "typically terrific barn-burning honky-tonkers and affecting tear- in-the-beer ballads." She goes on to call it "excellent song craftsmanship with great production."Billboard, June 24, 1995 ==Music video== The music video for this song was directed by Michael Oblowitz. It was filmed in and around San Antonio, Texas, and displays the duo singing the song within various western-themed landscapes, in addition to shots of Brooks riding horseback and a woman pacing around the same areas the duo are. The video reached No. 1 for one week on CMT Top 12 Countdown in 1995. ==Chart history== "You're Gonna Miss Me When I'm Gone" debuted at number 72 on the U.S. Billboard Hot Country Singles & Tracks for the week of June 10, 1995. {|class="wikitable" !align="left"|Chart (1995) !align="center"|Peak position |- |- |} ===Year-end charts=== {| class="wikitable" |- !scope="col"|Chart (1995) !scope="col"|Position |- | Canada Country Tracks (RPM) | align="center" | 21 |- | US Country Songs (Billboard) | align="center" | 13 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1995 singles Category:Brooks & Dunn songs Category:Billboard Hot Country Songs number-one singles Category:RPM Country Tracks number-one singles Category:Songs written by Kix Brooks Category:Songs written by Don Cook Category:Songs written by Ronnie Dunn Category:Song recordings produced by Scott Hendricks Category:Song recordings produced by Don Cook Category:Arista Nashville singles Category:1994 songs
